Case reference: 2019058725.CaseDesc: In the spring of 2019, Glenn Field was seen for the last time by a pilot flying over his campsite located at Rolfe Lake, Northwest Territories. Glenn had flown out to Rolfe Lake in September of 2018 with the intentions of spending the winter living on the land and making his way back to Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, in the Spring of 2019. Glenn had three dogs with him and food to last the winter. The RCMP Search and Rescue conducted an areal search of Rolfe Lake in October of 2019, but found no signs of Glenn.

Case reference: 2014004403.CaseDesc: Ramona Shular was last seen in Fort St John, British Columbia at the end of November 2003.

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Red heart and rose
Mark: Mole in front of left ear
Scar: Right Eye, Scar from right eyebrow to cheek bone

Case reference: 2018053572.CaseDesc: On February 15, 1996, Maymuna Mohamid was seen for the last time by her brother and sister-in-law in Toronto, Ontario. When her brother returned home, Maymuna and all her personal belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2013000123.CaseDesc: The remains of a middle-aged man was discovered in a bush area in Beacon Hill Park in Victoria, British Columbia on July 18, 1988. He had grey hair and long sideburns or a beard. It appears the man died within a month from when he was found.

Case reference: 2014005229.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2009 at around 11:00 am, Ronald Hallam was seen for the last time on his property on Prosperity Line road in the municipality of Ashfield-Colborne-Wawanosh, Ontario.

Pants: Brown, Khaki, Light brown work pants

Case reference: 2010003699.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday, May 31, 1974, 7 year old Cheryl Hanson left her home on Bloomington Road for a 10 minute walk to her cousin’s house, also located on Bloomington Road. She never arrived.  No trace of Cheryl or any of her belongings has ever been found.

Other: Paper bag with white pajamas with floral design

Case reference: 2020008397.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1981, Brian Orr was last seen by his parents in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Brian’s parents believe that he was in financial troubles.

Scar: Lower Left Back, 3 inches in length and half an inch wide
Right Eye, From nose to cheek bone on right eyelid

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2014001816.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1981, Wayne Martin was seen for the last time while he was out for a walk at the Rideau Heights Campground in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006241.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2013, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Ranjit Singh was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ranjit was visiting Toronto from India was scheduled to return on a 5:00 p.m. flight, but he never boarded the plane.

Case reference: 2014003573.CaseDesc: On October 11, 1978, George Greyeyes left from Petersfield, Manitoba on a hunting trip. He left by canoe and was supposed to return that same day. Water conditions were poor with high winds and waves. On October 12, 1978, he had not yet returned and was reported missing to police. Searches were conducted and he was never located. Mr. Greyeyes is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014001124.CaseDesc: The skeletal skull of a young middle-aged woman was found by a hunter on September 10, 1994, in a wooded area east of Golden, British Columbia. She may have had a dental overlap at the front and would have died about 5 years earlier.

Case reference: 2013000023.CaseDesc: Marilyn Ann Hersey left the Abbey Lane Hospital on January 28, 2006, and hasn't been seen since.  Marilyn is bi-polar and had to take medication for numerous ailments; she did not have her medication with her.

Case reference: 2009001399.CaseDesc: Calvin Vanness was last seen on March 26, 2008 at approximately 2:30 PM in the Quinte Mall parking lot in Belleville, Ontario. He last spoke to his family to make plans to meet later that day. When he failed to meet them, his family attempted to locate him, then reported him missing on March 31, 2008. His car was located on April 1, 2008 at the Highway 38 car park in Kingston, Ontario. He was known to carry large sums of money and some cannabis. Mr. Vanness has not accessed any of his bank accounts since his disappearance.

Case reference: 2019059675.CaseDesc: On February 26, 1989, the body of an unidentified man was found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had an abdominal hernia, and poor dental hygiene. The results of the autopsy showed evidence of chronic alcohol abuse, and he was likely despondent prior to his death.

Pants: Dark Blue, Marks and Spencer brand
Suit: Black, Osman Brand, Warm up suit, X Large

Case reference: 2012020077.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1986, Alexander Wiwchar, 72 years old, was last seen at 2:00 p.m. in Yorkton, SK. Mr. Wiwchar, who lived on a farm near Canora, SK, was seen at the Yorkton Bus Depot. Mr. Wiwchar is believed to have had some medical concerns and was suspected of having Alzheimer’s disease. His destination was unknown and he has not been seen or located since.

Mark: Chest, 9th rib fractured on the right side

Case reference: 2013000110.CaseDesc: Robert Gorassi is a full time resident in Toronto and was on an outing at Kinark Outdoor Centre where he was last seen at 4:30 p.m on October 25, 2012.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Grizzled beard, moustache & sideburns

Case reference: 2006000499.CaseDesc:
On July 12, 1989, the body of a male was recovered from the Whirlpool basin in the Niagara River. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 167lbs and his length was measured to be between  5’9"-5’10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His appendix was present.
He was recovered without any clothing or personal effects. It is estimated that he had been in the water for some days to weeks prior to recovery.

Hair: Black, Curly, Tightly curled, male pattern baldness and a moustache
Teeth: Severe crowding of ant. teeth, Most post. teeth are amalgam restorations, U-Left 1st premolar & 3rd molars: lost before death
Scar: Small 1.5cm oblique scar on his right knee

Case reference: 2020007351.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1981, at approximately 3:00pm, Maria Cowan was last seen as she left her home with a friend to go shopping in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Leather, Brown, Fur on collar and sleeves

Case reference: 2019071976.CaseDesc: In September of 2012, Donald Watson was last seen by his mother, and his family has had no contact with him since this time. Donald is transient in nature and usually travels on foot as transportation. Canada Border Services Agency’s last documentation of Donald was in 2013 when he entered Laredo, Texas in the United States from Mexico as a pedestrian.

Case reference: 2021047780.CaseDesc: Vincent McLean was last seen on October 1, 2021, at a rural property where he resided in Two Hills County, Alberta. There has been no activity from him since that date.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2017020043.CaseDesc: Louis Judah Gonick was seen being picked up by taxi cab at his University dormitory residence at 7:09 PM, April 16, 2017, and was last seen at 7:32 PM, being dropped off at the Stanley Park causeway.

Case reference: 2014001277.CaseDesc: On July 26, 1987, Sukhminder Singh Grewal was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. He came to Canada and performed as a singer in an East Indian Music Troupe that toured across the country. Sukhminder has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020028.CaseDesc: Chantelle Bushie was reported missing by her family on September 14, 2009. She has not been heard from since December 2007. Chantelle was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2008006798.CaseDesc: Jason Russell was last seen at the Casino in Niagara Falls. Mr. Russell was a student at Brock University in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2014003615.CaseDesc: On September 26th, 1970, Mr. Claus and his friend were reported missing to police as they were overdue by boat. A pilot later spotted a swamped boat on Cormorant Lake, Manitoba and advised police. Despite patrols and dragging operations Mr. Claus was never located. His partner was later found and the cause of death determined to be drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2011000399.CaseDesc: Kathy Bordato was reported missing in early February, 2010.  Police believe that she was last seen on or about August 16, 2009, between 7:00 and 8:30 am in the area of Cavendish Park near Walnut Street in London, Ontario. Police conducted a search of the area where Ms. Bordato was last seen and believe there are still witnesses with information to offer in relation to the investigation.

Tattoo: Left Hand, Tattoo of female  symbol between thumb and finger, left hand

Case reference: 2014004448.CaseDesc: Carmelo Tomasino was last seen on January 19, 2004 in Montreal. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Tattoo: Chest, Hearts with the names Amanda and Brenda

Case reference: 2018063868.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2018, Apu Akbar was last seen by his roommates at his home in St. John’s, Newfoundland. Mr. Akbar’s grey Honda Civic was located on November 8, 2018, in the area of Kavanagh’s Lane and Windgap Road in Flatrock, Newfoundland. The keys were still in the ignition and his cellphone was found in the vehicle. Apu is originally from Bangladesh.

Case reference: 2020001488.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Edward Parsons was seen for the last time as he was dragged from his apartment by a street gang in Toronto, Ontario. Edward was taken to a beach where he was violently assaulted, and buried in a shallow grave. The police were informed of this incident, and attended the grave. Upon their arrival, the alleged burial site was found empty.

Case reference: 2010000699.CaseDesc: William Ostertag last spoke to his brother on December 16, 1990.  He was reported missing when he failed to show up for his work Christmas party in North Bay.

Hair: Black, Short, Comb over, moustache, sideburns
Coat: May have been wearing a blue or grey coat

Case reference: 2005006199.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1975, the remains of an unidentified man were found in a wooded area near an unused logging road in the northeast corner of North Bay. Anthropological analysis suggests that he may be Caucasian and has been dead in excess of 1-2 years.

Case reference: 2014001128.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1991, the body of an unknown female was found floating in the Fraser River in New Westminster, BC.  She was observed on the water directly under the Patullo Bridge between the wharf and a fishing vessel called the "Sea Cap X". The female had been in the water for a prolonged period of time and may be of Aboriginal or Asian descent.

Belt: Leather, Blue, With a belt buckle
Jewelry: Gold, Hoop earrings in both ears
Gold, Cardinal brand wristwatch, right wrist
Scar: Right Wrist, 3 cm horizontal and 1 cm oblique

Case reference: 2016061103.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2003, a male was found in the Detroit River, near the Livingston Channel in Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He may have been a heavy coffee drinker or smoker. His appendix was present. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Black, Brown, Straight, Greying moustache and beard
Teeth: Upper denture and a lower partial plate
Other: Detroit area bus pass dated November 2002
Jacket: Dark Green, Orange, Bomber style, knitted waist and cuffs, orange lining

Case reference: 2014003814.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1980, Leon Kitchekesik and his parents were staying at their cabin on Gull Lake. Leon was walking along the shore with his three year old sister. The parents went to investigate when they heard the screams of their daughter. The parents located footprints approaching a small hole and none leading away from the hole. There was a land search conducted however it is felt the boy drowned.

Case reference: 2014004372.CaseDesc: Patrick-Jean De Loppinot was last seen on September 11, 2003, at a friend's residence in Laval. He was supposed to go home but never arrived. He left with a black 1990 Volkswagen Jetta registered in Québec. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. De Loppinot lived with family in Longueuil. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2014006246.CaseDesc: On March 30, 1991, Jason O'Donaghey's roommate reported him missing as he had not been seen for 3 days. There were rumours that Jason left North Vancouver voluntarily, but his whereabouts are still unknown. He was a talented artist who may be making a living by selling aboriginal carvings.

Hair: Black, Long, Short on top, long at bottom
Shirt: Cotton, White, Dress shirt with longsleeve

Case reference: 2019030954.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2019, Tara Sculptor was seen for the last time by her mother on Carling Avenue in Ottawa, Ontario. It is possible that Tara took a bus from Ottawa to North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, A bald spot on the back of the head
Scar: Forehead, Severe burns to the face
Right Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Left Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Back Of Head, Skin graft removed from behind

Case reference: 2006016999.CaseDesc: Donald Hemsworth was last seen in the area surrounding Twitchgrass and Hilda Lakes, Farr Township on October 8, 1974.

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Mr. Vrba. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Mr. Clemens and Mr. Everett are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2014001361.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2000, Emmanuel Emond was reported missing in Clair, New Brunswick. Emmanuel was last seen by his family on November 28, 1996. Emmanuel is believed to have gone to Mexico at a certain point.

Scar: Cheek, Scar between nose and mouth
Tattoo: Left Hand, X on top of left hand

Case reference: 2020008393.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1982, David Black was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. David is a chronic cancer patient.

Case reference: 2012020179.CaseDesc: This adult Caucasian female was recovered from a freight yard north of 127 Water Street. in Vancouver.

Case reference: 2012020658.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1993, Joyce Tillotson was last seen in Regina, Saskatchewan, when she left her residence to visit a friend. She never arrived at her friend’s home. Joyce was originally from the Carry The Kettle First Nation near Indian Head in Saskatchewan.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , "TR" text on bicep

Case reference: 2009002699.CaseDesc: Norman Welsh was on holidays with his mother and an incident occurred on July 18, 1976, which subsequently led him to the hospital. While in the hospital he was described as bitter and un-cooperative wanting to return home in St Catharines. While being escorted to the North Bay Pyschiatric Hospital (now Northeast Mental Health Centre), he ran off into the wooded area.

Teeth: Stained, Has a 2 tooth partial plate and is missing his front upper left tooth, teeth slightly stained
Scar: Head, Under the hair, due to an operation at the age of 16

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2012020126.CaseDesc: Rollande Doherty, 52 years old, disappeared on February 2nd 2007. She was last seen around 2:30pm near the library in Rouyn-Noranda.

Case reference: 2014005364.CaseDesc: Antoinette Neveu was reported missing on January 11, 1991, after failing to arrive at her place of employment in Edmonton, Alberta. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005078.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1992, Gloria Abotossaway was last seen by a family member on Shuter Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005520.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2010, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Dina Bat-Og was seen for the last time leaving her home to go to work in Toronto, Ontario. Dina had advised that she would be returning home at midnight, but never returned.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2014006219.CaseDesc: On the night of the 17 to 18 August 2013, Benoit Germain was seen for the last time while he was attending a truck show in Baie-du-Febvre, Qebec. His car was found abandoned a few days later on a trail to a wooded area north of La Tuque, Quebec. Benoit has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2008003999.CaseDesc: Bernard Champagne was last seen on July 10, 1997.  He was a bachelor and lived alone for 40 years in a cabin with no running water or electricity, located behind the Rodrigue residence.  Richard Rodrigue was concerned that night had fallen and Mr. Champagne had not returned to his cabin.  Mr. Rodrigue contacted the police and a search by canine, helicopter, and E.R.T. was conducted but proved unsuccessful in locating Mr. Champagne.

Case reference: 2014004635.CaseDesc: In 1986, Sarah Skunk visited with family members located in Mishkeegogamang First Nation and Shabaqua, ON. Since that time, she has not been heard from by any family members. Family fears that she may be deceased. Sarah was known to frequent Vancouver BC, Sudbury ON, and Washington State, USA. Sarah spent some time on the streets. She was known by numerous aliases and may have had children.

Mark: Mouth, Wart on inside of mouth

Case reference: 2014008479.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2014 William Grange was on vacation at the Cambridge Beach Resort and Spa in Bermuda. In the evening, he walked away from the resort.

Jewelry: Gold, wedding band with one diamond
Scar: Unknown, Small white scar, approx. 3" long, on top of hand, unknown right or left hand
Left Side Of Head, Surgical scar on left side of head/scalp from brain surgery

Case reference: 2009001499.CaseDesc: Louis Riklik was last seen on October 12, 2008, in the Toronto area. On October 19, 2008, Mr. Riklik entered the Bruce Peninsula National Park. His vehicle, a blue 2003 Mazda minivan, was located at the Halfway Log Dump Road parking lot. This is an access point to the Bruce trail. An extensive ground, air and water search was conducted by the OPP, Mr. Riklik was not found.

Case reference: 2014005579.CaseDesc: In the early hours of January 17, 1991, Darrell Watt was seen for the last time as he left the Beverly Crest Hotel tavern in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of his disappearance, Darrell was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and was a known associate of a motorcycle club.

Case reference: 2014002474.CaseDesc: Kenley Matheson was a student at Acadia University, Wolfville, Nova Scotia in September 1992. On September 21st it was reported that he was seen by a friend walking on Main Street in Wolfville, N.S. This was the last time anyone has seen or heard from Kenley Matheson.

Jewelry: Gold, Necklace - gold eagle pendant, 1 IN
Metal, White, Watch - White Face Seiko, 8M2571000, SN 040792
Gold, Earring worn in left ear
Coat: Nylon, Blue, Helly Hansen, mountain coat

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002220.CaseDesc: Melvin Hoel was last seen in the Cataract Creek area where his abandoned vehicle with all his belongings was located by agents of Fish and Wildlife.

Case reference: 2013000051.CaseDesc: Darren Fortier was last seen hitchhiking in Port Hardy on the evening of December 30, 1998.  Mr. Fortier had been involved in a serious injury a few years earlier which had left him with a metal plate and pins in his leg and a brain injury.

Hat: Cotton, Blue, Maroon, Colorado Avalanche Baseball Cap
Scar: Chin, Distinct on the left side of chin
Cheek, Down the right side of the face
Nose, Across the bridge of the nose
Foreign Object: Left Thigh, Surgical Implant, Plate and 5 screws

Case reference: 2014006282.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2012, a relative of Jean Marc Lavallée called the Roussillon Inter-municipal police to check on Mr. Lavallée at his residence in La Prairie, Québec, as they were worried about him. The police found that Mr. Lavallée was not at his residence, and his vehicle was not in the parking lot. The police took numerous steps to locate Mr. Lavallée, but he remains missing. He was seen for the last time on November 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2014005293.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 20, 1999, Abdol Hossein was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Cheek, Welts all over his face and cheek

Case reference: 2014003046.CaseDesc: Yu Lowe was last seen on February 15, 1984 when he left his home in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Lowe said he was going to the movies and never came back.

Case reference: 2013000144.CaseDesc: Robert Angelo Furgiuele from Sault Ste-Marie, Ontario was last seen in Squamish, British-Columbia in 1991. He was residing in Squamish with his girlfriend and his daughter. He was working in a grocery store at the time. He last spoke to his mother by telephone in 1991. He might have moved to Vancouver Island, British-Columbia in 1992.

Case reference: 2014001095.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 11, 1998, the body of an adult female believed to be between the ages of 30-40, with long dark hair and blue eyes was found deceased at the Broadway SkyTrain Station in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was very lean and pale and was wearing a long red wool coat over jeans and black ankle boots.

Coat: Wool, Red, Long coat with hood

Case reference: 2014029389.CaseDesc: Jed Ouillette was last seen on the afternoon of September 8, 2014. Personal identification items were left behind at his residence. Mr. Ouillette had lost his driver's license due to medical issues involving seizures and was in financial difficulty.

Case reference: 2014003913.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1973, Martin MAIER, 63 years old, was last seen leaving the Prelate, SK hotel at 1:00 a.m. Mr. MAIER was driving a 1971 Chevrolet half-ton, red with white half camper box, SK license F133013.  Extensive searches have been conducted, however neither Mr. MAIER or his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Wool, Other, Siwash with a fish design

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2013000128.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1990, Delphine Nikal was left in the care of her uncle. At approximately 2:00 pm Delphine advised her uncle she was going to meet her three girlfriends in Smithers BC (approx 16 km. away).  Delphine hitchhiked to Smithers and met up with her friends. At approximately 10:00 pm Delphine called her uncle to tell him that she was on her way home from Smithers. She was last seen by her two friends hitchhiking in the east bound lane of Hwy #16.

Jacket: Denim, Blue, Light bleached with white pocket sewn on inside, Levi's
Purse: Leather, Black, Pouch style containing hair spray, brush, pictures, make up, address book
Pants: Denim, Pink, Described as a hot pink and tight to the leg. Knee length

Case reference: 2006006899.CaseDesc: Ruth Jackson is an Alzheimer's patient, who was travelling in a car with her husband, who is also an Alzheimer's patient.  At some point, Mrs. Jackson got out of their vehicle and her husband drove off. He cannot recall where he left his wife. They were last seen together in the Elm Tree Road area of Kaladar.  An extensive air and ground search was conducted with negative results. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 1989125890.CaseDesc: Jeffrey was taken by a couple driving a 1979-80 blue chevy truck.

Case reference: 2014004497.CaseDesc: It is believed Vernon Resch may have travelled to British Columbia.  He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002743.CaseDesc: On January 16, 1994, Yoann Crouzatier was reported missing after leaving the family residence in Laval, Quebec. Yoann has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Beige, Three-quarters with fur trimmed hood
Boots: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal tips

Case reference: 2020006266.CaseDesc: On February 25, 1959, Richard "Ricky" Culford was seen for the last time on Ward’s Island in Toronto, Ontario. He was last seen playing on the beach with a stick. When his mother went to retrieve him, Ricky was gone.

Hat: Brown, Gabardine helmet with a peak

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: Hellen Ermias and her daughter Lina Tedros entered Canada seeking asylum.  They were provided a temporary apartment but disappeared shortly after with no explanation and without their belongings.

Case reference: 2006025899.CaseDesc: Robin Windross has not been seen since November 1977. He has an intellectual age of about 6 years old, speaks with a strong speech impediment and is difficult to understand. He may have left Huronia Regional Centre because he was concerned about being transferred in the facility to a unit with mostly adults. He had always been housed with children.

Case reference: 2014004157.CaseDesc: When last seen Mark Krostewitz may have been planning a trip to Europe, however, relatives in Europe have not seen or heard from him.  His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014002963.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, Nicholas Leonard was seen for the last time rowing a homemade kayak towards the north end of Lower Loon Lake in the town of Wabush, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014001530.CaseDesc: Ronald Nodeland was last seen by his family on August 20, 1978 at his residence in Edson. Mr. Nodeland’s motorcycle and helmet were recovered approximately one month later in a remote area south west of Sundre, Alberta. Mr. Nodeland may have been seen on foot in the area a short time later however he was never located.

Case reference: 2016061093.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1972, a female was found in Lake Erie, west of the Colchester light, east of the Detroit Channel, near the Town of Colchester, Ontario. Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-180 lbs however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She is believed to have been dead for 1-5 weeks.

Shoes: Brown, Loafers, made in Japan with 4 diamonds shape buttons on top, size 10
Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Short sleeved, collar and round brass buttons

Case reference: 2011000699.CaseDesc: On 23 May 1985, William Drake walked out of the Pinecrest Home for senior citizens, where he lived.  He was last seen at 9:30 am walking eastbound on highway 17 in Kenora, near the Sunset Husky gas station.  His family and friends have not heard from him since. Mr. Drake is reported to be hard of hearing and diabetic.

Pants: Light Blue, small checks and suspenders

Case reference: 2020011626.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1989, Ioan Sandea was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003355.CaseDesc: Kelsey Brew and his friends were playing on the rocks on the shores of the Hudson Bay in Churchill. According to the witness Kelsey attempted to help another boy who had fallen in the water. As Kelsey was helping, a wave came in and he also slipped into the water. A large number of volunteers walked the shoreline and boat patrols failed to locate him. It is assumed Kelsey drowned.

Scar: Cheek, 3 on left side of face

Case reference: 2018063267.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2001, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Silvia Stewart was seen for the last time at the Caribana Parade in Toronto, Ontario. Silvia had been visiting Toronto with her daughter from South Carolina, USA, and she suffers from Alzheimer’s.

Case reference: 2014006195.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2004, Randy Boudreau was last seen at his residence in Campbellton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014005093.CaseDesc: Hooshang Imanpoorsaid was last seen on May 2, 2008. At that time, he was living in Brossard. He was reported missing by his family. Mr. Imanpoorsaid’s credit card was used at Dorval airport and the Netherlands in 2008. He is of Iranian descent.

Case reference: 2016068714.CaseDesc: On June 26, 1967, the remains of a female were recovered from the Niagara River. Her post-mortem length was measured at 5’1”-5’2”, however, this measurement may not represent her actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Her appendix was present. The body is believed to have been in the water for some months to years prior to recovery.

Case reference: 2014005536.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of March 25, 1996, Renée Simard was seen for the last time as she left her family home in Matane, Quebec. Renée had indicated that she was going for a walk, and at approximately 2:30 p.m. she was seen near the wharf along the Matane River at the mouth of the St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2012020104.CaseDesc: On Saturday, April 15, 2006, Francis Albert-Cloutier was seen for the last time at his home located in Saint-Marc-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. His vehicle, a black 2001 Chrysler Intrepid was found on the following day by a passerby on an ATV trail in Saint-Amable, Quebec. No one has since seen or heard from Francis.

Jewelry: Gold, A ring with colored stone on each middle finger

Case reference: 2014002711.CaseDesc: Sharel Haresym was reported missing September 6, 1984, he was last seen was on September 4, 1984. Mr. Haresym's vehicle was located parked on the entrance road to Twin Lakes campground near Winfield, Alberta. The vehicle was out of fuel and also had a dead battery. Mr. Haresym's clothing was located approximately 100 yards east of his vehicle. His clothing was laid out in a neat and orderly fashion with his bible alongside.

Case reference: 2014004730.CaseDesc: Geoffry MacGibbon was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. In 1978, Geoffrey and his family moved to Toronto, Ontario from Quebec. He is schizophrenic and has been in several mental institutions in Canada and the United States of America.

Scar: Front Of Neck, Tracheostomy scar on throat
